data.text:
Brian Benben is a famous American actor, adored by fans and movie lovers alike for his roles in the popular series Dream On and Private Practice He is also an object of admiration for many, and his unique ability to portray any role he is assigned to play with the utmost ease and perfection makes it plausible how he was able to remain relevant in an ever-changing Hollywood film industry. Still want to know more about Brian Benben in terms of his career and personal life? Keep scrolling down.

Brian Benben’s Bio (Age)

Veteran actor Brian Edward Benben was born on 18. June 1956 in Winchester, Virginia, USA to his parents, Gloria Patricia and Peter Michael Benben Sr. Very little information is available about Brian Benben’s childhood and family as he does not wish to forget this aspect of his life away from the ever inquisitive eyes of the media. However, it is known that he was raised by his parents in Marlboro, New York and attended a secondary school very close to where he lives.

After completing his schooling, he enrolled at Ulster Community College in Stone Ridge, New York, graduating two years later. Benben, who had just finished college, decided to move to New York City where he slowly perfected his acting skills by appearing in various Off-Off-Broadway theatres. The Fang of Crime, Gossip, Wild Oats, A Moon for the Misborn, The Mantle, and Midsummer Night ‘s Dream in which he played the role of Bottom.

In 1981, Benben took on the role of Michael Lasker in The Gangster Chronicles, marking his television debut and introducing him to a wider audience. Later that year he made his big screen debut in Gangster Wars In 1983, he demonstrated his versatility by portraying the role of a gay man in the drama film. American Playhouse: Family Business, before taking on the role of the highly controversial California Senator Tom Hayden in the film Conspiracy: The Chicago Trial

His big break finally came in 1990, following his role as Martin Tupper in the HBO adult-themed comedy Dream On. He was the main character of the series for six years, until its finale in March 1996. In 2008, he starred with Dr. Sheldon Wallace in the television series Private Practice is probably the second biggest role of his career. Since then he has made a reasonable number of appearances on several TV shows such as Scandals, Roadies and Impostors to name a few.

wife and children

Do some research on BrianBenben’s married life and you’ll be amazed to find that, unlike most of his acting cohorts, the famous actor is happily married, with no rumors of infidelity or imminent divorce. His beloved wife is none other than the beautiful actress Madeline Marie Stowe (born August 18, 1958). According to the story, they met on the set of The Gangster Chronicles in 1981 and decided to get married the following year. The beautiful couple gave birth to a beautiful baby girl named May Theodora who was born in 1996.

height and body measurements

The Dream-On actor is actually not as tall as he appears in the movies. He is 5 feet 7 inches tall when standing. There is currently no information on his weight and other important body measurements. However, he has an average build, which is a sign of a healthy life on his part.

More facts about Brian Benben

Below are 5 quick facts that would greatly improve your knowledge of the famous actor.

1. Unlike most celebrities who claim to have had a knack for acting since childhood, Brian Benben is an exception. He didn’t decide to become an actor until his sophomore year.

2. In 1993 he won a CableACE award for Best Actor in a Comedy Series, and that has been his only award to date.

3. He currently lives in Austin, Texas with his family

4. Brian and his wife Madeline were once robbed at gunpoint of a $79,000 antique jewelry collection at their LA home.
